title: Particle MCMC in forecasting frailty correlated default models with expert opinion. (arXiv:2304.11586v1 [q-fin.RM])
abstract: Predicting corporate default risk has long been a crucial topic in the finance field, as bankruptcies impose enormous costs on market participants as well as the economy as a whole. This paper aims to forecast frailty correlated default models with subjective judgements on a sample of U.S. public non-financial firms spanning January 1980-June 2019. We consider a reduced-form model and adopt a Bayesian approach coupled with the Particle Markov Chain Monte Carlo (Particle MCMC) algorithm to scrutinize this problem. The findings show that the volatility and the mean reversion of the hidden factor, which determine the dependence of the unobserved default intensities on the latent variable, have a highly economically and statistically significant positive impact on the default intensities of the firms. translated_title: 专家意见下的粒子马尔可夫链蒙特卡罗方法用于预测脆弱相关违约模型
translated_abstract: 预测公司违约风险一直是金融领域的一个关键话题，因为破产对市场参与者以及整个经济都会造成巨大的成本。本文旨在预测涵盖1980年1月至2019年6月的一组美国公共非金融公司的脆弱相关违约模型，并结合粒子马尔可夫链蒙特卡罗（Particle MCMC）算法和贝叶斯方法来研究该问题。研究发现，隐藏因素的波动性和均值回归对未观察到的违约强度与潜在变量的依赖关系有着非常显著的正向影响。结果还表明，对于具有不同先验分布的脆弱相关违约模型，1年的预测相对较好，而当预测时间跨度延长到2年和3年时，预测准确率下降。
tldr: 本文使用贝叶斯方法和粒子马尔可夫链蒙特卡罗算法结合专家意见，预测涵盖1980年1月至2019年6月美国公共非金融公司的脆弱相关违约模型。结果显示隐藏因素的波动性和均值回归对未观察到的违约强度与潜在变量的依赖关系有着显著的正向影响，1年的预测相对较好，而当预测时间跨度延长到2年和3年时，预测准确率下降。
en_tdlr: This paper uses a Bayesian approach and Particle Markov Chain Monte Carlo algorithm coupled with expert opinions to forecast frailty correlated default models of a sample of U.S. public non-financial firms spanning from January 1980-June 2019. The findings show that volatility and mean reversion of the hidden factor have a significant positive impact on the default intensities of the firms, with the 1-year prediction being relatively good but decreasing in accuracy for 2 and 3-year predictions.
